creator: pkrause@soundbite.com
text:
The optional sound task has a nested "fail" element that caused an incorrect 
dtd to be generated by antstructure.  One of the "fail" elements needs to be 
renamed, unless the antstructure task can be enhanced to disambiguate them 
somehow.

creator: holtdl@yahoo.com
text:
The element probably should have been called <failure> from the first 
(success/failure is the right pairing, English-wise -- fail goes with 
succeed).  You could add a <failure> and deprecate <fail>, but <fail> would 
still have to be around for backward-compatibility.

creator: bodewig@apache.org
text:
Well, <junit>'s <test> conflicts with the optional <test> task (since Ant 1.2 or
so).  This is not really a new issue - we quite clearly say that it is not
really possible to create a valid DTD for Ant.

CANTFIX - as the same problem will occur over and over again, especially with 
third party task we have no control over.

Backwards compatability with what?  The sound task is new in Ant 1.5.  Fix it 
now while its still in beta!

junit/test vs testlet/test is a much more complex issue.  Lets not try to solve 
that here.
creator: pkrause@soundbite.com
bodewig@apache.org
text: <sound> has been part of 1.4 as well as 1.4.1

creator: bodewig@apache.org
text: Actually, it has been added in 1.3.

creator: pkrause@soundbite.com
text:
I stand corrected.  Only this behavior is new in 1.5.  But I don't know how to 
account for it.

I don't see any interesting changes in AntStucture since 1.4.1, and the only 
interesting change that I can see in IntrospectionHelper is the introduction of 
DynamicConfigurator.
